block.p: To the Editor: Regarding "A Parisian Trip to the 1700's" by Mervyn Rothstein (Travel, Jan. 20), it was my privilege to spend a leisurely autumn afternoon at the Nissim de Camondo Museum last year. It is rewarding to walk through the Parc Monceau before entering the museum. The sense of history and a slowing of pace create the right frame of mind for enjoying the collection.

If one is not able to go to Paris to visit this museum, the interiors may be seen in the recent Milos Forman film "Valmont." Many scenes were photographed in the museum and in the Sixth Arrondissement (the Marais district). THOMAS LEE RANDLEMAN Cleveland
